intro: Christisonia subacaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kowhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive narrow, strap-like shape. Christisonia subacaulis is often found in coastal and lowland forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
